onset.Description: Onset of clip relative to full film file

Pride.Instructions: Pride is a feeling of pleasure or satisfaction with ones achievements. Shame is a feeling of humiliation or distress when a person is conscious of their wrongdoings or faults. Move the gauge up as you feel more proud. Move it down as you feel more ashamed. You may use the middle of the scale if you feel neither pride nor shame.

Tackle.Description: You felt like tackling the situation and do something
Tackle.Instructions: Move the gauge up if you feel like tackling the situation and doing something. Move it down as you do not feel an urge to takle the situation.

Frown.Instructions: Move the gauge up as you observe yourself frowning. Move it down as you are not frowning.

Controlled.Instructions: Controlled is an event that could have been averted or stopped. Move the gauge up the more controlled you perceive the situation and down as the situation is less controlled i.e. uncontrolled.

Happiness.Instructions: Happiness is a feeling of joy opposite to feeling sad. Move the gauge up as you feel more happy. Move it down as you feel less happy.
